intro: Micromeles alnifolia var. lyciocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited sand thorn, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, spiny leaves and distinctive red, fleshy fruits. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its fruits are edible and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems and providing food for local wildlife.
